SG Lourens Nursing College

SG Lourens Nursing College is a nursing education institution based in Pretoria, South Africa. The college is dedicated to providing high-quality nursing education and training that is responsive to the changing needs of the healthcare industry in South Africa. The college offers a range of nursing programs, including a four-year diploma in nursing, a two-year bridging course for enrolled nurses to become registered nurses, and various short courses.

The mission of SG Lourens Nursing College is to provide a stimulating learning environment that promotes critical thinking, lifelong learning, and the development of competent and compassionate nurses who are able to provide safe and effective care to patients in a variety of settings.

To apply to SG Lourens Nursing College, prospective students must meet certain eligibility criteria and submit an application form, along with supporting documents. The specific application requirements may vary depending on the program you are applying to, so it’s important to check the college’s website or contact them directly for the most up-to-date information.

What to Know About the SG Lourens Nursing College Application Form Portal

The SG Lourens Nursing College SGLNC Application portal is designed to accept applications of candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slips, check the admission list, etc.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission to the SGLNC application portal, candidates must;

  • Have a Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to SGLNC on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%

How to Apply | SGLNC Application Form 2024

Eligible candidates can click here to apply.

Follow the steps below

  • Visit the Application portal: https://www.sglourens.co.za/
  • Choose the type of Application (Undergraduate, Post Graduate, Semester Studies)
  • Fill and complete all necessary pages
  • Pay Application fees where required

 

How much is nursing at SG Lourens?

1 Year Diploma in Midwifery – R6000 Per Annum.
1 Year Diploma in Community Nursing Science – R3000 Per Annum.

SG Lourens Nursing College Application Required Documents

To apply to SGLNC you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript

For more information regarding the application for admission into the SG Lourens Nursing College, kindly drop your messages in the comment box below.

S G Lourens Nursing College entry requirements

You must meet the following requirements to enter the NVC at NQF Level 2:

  • A year-end report for students in Grades 9, 10, 11, or 12 or an annual report
  • A National Qualification Framework (NQF) Level 1 qualification,
  • An approved bridging curriculum created specifically for the aim of gaining entrance to NQF Level 2, or
  • To achieve the fundamental requirements for entrance to NQF Level 2, a Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) assessment is required

Best Subjects for Nursing Career in South Africa?

To pursue BSc Nursing, the candidates should have minimum eligibility criteria, having completed 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as mandatory
